name: impudence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being rude and not showing respect, especially towards someone who is older or in a more important position: With a hint of impudence she told him not to talk. The memoir describes his life with honesty and impudence. See
impudent
More examplesFewer examplesHe was all youthful bravado and impudence. Mrs Grundy could take no more of such impudence and asked Annie to leave within the hour. Several committee members had the impudence to complain about not being consulted.
